title: Discord: default invite expiration (DISCORD_INVITE_MAX_AGE_SECONDS)
description:
Epic: talk-19w
Epic file: .context/plans/platform-hardening.md
Gate: Invite expiration defaults (configurable)

Context:
- Default-expiring invites reduce risk if links are leaked and keep old submissions from being joinable forever.

Scope boundaries:
- ✅ IN scope: backend/config.ts (env var parsing + validation + DiscordConfig.inviteMaxAge), backend/discord.ts (use inviteMaxAge for max_age), ensure logs do not leak invite codes
- ❌ OUT of scope: README updates (handled by docs bead), any changes to submission success page / QR code

Done means:
- loadEnv() supports DISCORD_INVITE_MAX_AGE_SECONDS with default 604800 and validation (0 or 1..604800)
- DiscordService.createInvite uses config.inviteMaxAge for Discord API max_age
- No logs include invite code/URL (treat as secret)

Verification:
- deno check --allow-import backend/index.ts — expected: no type errors
- Manual: set DISCORD_INVITE_MAX_AGE_SECONDS=3600 and call POST /api/discord/test; confirm invite shows ~1h expiry in Discord UI

Red-Green-Refactor plan:
- Red: observe current createInvite uses max_age=0 (never expires)
- Green: wire inviteMaxAge through config + Discord API call
- Refactor: centralize config parsing helpers if needed
close_reason:

- backend/config.ts: parses+validates env var; adds DiscordConfig.inviteMaxAge
- backend/discord.ts: createInvite now uses inviteMaxAge for Discord API max_age

title: Security: protect admin/test endpoints with ADMIN_TOKEN
description:
Epic: talk-19w
Epic file: .context/plans/platform-hardening.md
Gate: Protect admin/test endpoints with ADMIN_TOKEN

Context:
- GET /api/submissions returns full submission data (PII). POST /api/discord/test can be used to spam Discord. Both must be protected.

Scope boundaries:
- ✅ IN scope: backend/auth.ts (requireAdmin middleware + timing-safe compare helper), backend/index.ts (apply middleware to GET /api/submissions and POST /api/discord/test), keep ENABLE_TEST_API gating
- ❌ OUT of scope: README updates (handled by docs bead), new admin UI

Done means:
- New backend/auth.ts exports requireAdmin() Hono middleware
- Middleware enforces Authorization: Bearer $ADMIN_TOKEN, returns 500 if missing token and 401 if unauthorized
- Token compare is timing-safe (no ===); pads to equal length before comparing
- Auth failure logs include timestamp + cf-connecting-ip (but never the token value)
- backend/index.ts routes /api/submissions and /api/discord/test are protected

Verification:
- deno check --allow-import backend/index.ts — expected: no type errors
- Manual: curl GET /api/submissions without auth -> 401/500; with correct header -> 200
- Manual: POST /api/discord/test requires both ADMIN_TOKEN auth and ENABLE_TEST_API=true

Red-Green-Refactor plan:
- Red: confirm endpoints currently accessible without auth
- Green: add middleware + apply to routes
- Refactor: share admin auth helper with autothread debug console if appropriate

title: Abuse: SQLite-backed rate limiting for POST /api/submissions
description:
Epic: talk-19w
Epic file: .context/plans/platform-hardening.md
Gate: Submission rate limiting (abuse control)

Context:
- Prevent burst spam and accidental double-submits from overwhelming Discord + SQLite.

Scope boundaries:
- ✅ IN scope: backend/rate-limit.ts (RateLimiter + middleware), backend/config.ts (RATE_LIMIT_* env vars + RuntimeConfig), backend/index.ts (conditional middleware on POST /api/submissions), SQLite schema rate_limit_store
- ❌ OUT of scope: Captcha, per-user auth, docs updates (handled by docs bead)

Done means:
- New backend/rate-limit.ts exports RateLimiter + rateLimitMiddleware(limiter)
- Rate limit key uses cf-connecting-ip only (fallback "unknown")
- Sliding window stored as JSON array of epoch_ms; includes updated_at for retention
- Concurrency-safe transaction (BEGIN IMMEDIATE) with retry/backoff and fail-open on persistent SQLITE_BUSY
- On limit: returns 429 JSON { error: "Rate limit exceeded" } and Retry-After header (int seconds, rounded up)

Verification:
- deno check --allow-import backend/index.ts — expected: no type errors
- Manual: loop curl POST /api/submissions from one IP until 429; confirm Retry-After decreases over time

Red-Green-Refactor plan:
- Red: reproduce many quick submissions (currently all succeed)
- Green: implement minimal limiter + middleware + env config
- Refactor: tighten transaction/retry logic + logs

title: DB: add indexes for submissions + autothread cooldown queries
description:
Epic: talk-19w
Epic file: .context/plans/platform-hardening.md
Gate: DB indexes + optional retention (indexes portion)

Context:
- Indexes keep admin listing and autothread cooldown checks fast as data grows.

Scope boundaries:
- ✅ IN scope: backend/index.ts (CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS on talk_submissions_3(created_at)), backend/autothread/store.ts (CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS on processed table (channel_id, status, processed_at))
- ❌ OUT of scope: retention cron (separate bead), schema renames / data migrations

Done means:
- initDatabase() creates submissions created_at index idempotently
- AutothreadStore.initTables() creates composite index for processed table idempotently
- Index names are stable and include namespace/table name to avoid collisions

Verification:
- deno check --allow-import backend/index.ts — expected: no type errors
- Manual: run autothread debug health endpoint and ensure initTables still succeeds

Red-Green-Refactor plan:
- Red: explain current lack of indexes + potential slow queries
- Green: add CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS statements
- Refactor: group DB init/index creation into helpers if it improves clarity

title: Ops: add retention cron for autothread logs + rate_limit_store
description:
Epic: talk-19w
Epic file: .context/plans/platform-hardening.md
Gate: DB indexes + optional retention (retention portion)

Context:
- Keep non-critical log tables from growing unbounded; reduce storage + query overhead.

Scope boundaries:
- ✅ IN scope: new backend/retention.cron.ts (daily cleanup), backend/config.ts (AUTOTHREAD_LOG_RETENTION_DAYS, RATE_LIMIT_RETENTION_DAYS), delete guardrails (allow-list, batching, transactions)
- ❌ OUT of scope: deleting talk submissions, changing talk_submissions_* schema

Done means:
- backend/retention.cron.ts exists and deletes only from allow-listed tables
- Retention is configurable and can be disabled by setting days=0
- Deletes are batched (LIMIT 100) inside transactions; busy_timeout set; lock failures skip table and continue
- Logs show deleted counts per table and cutoff date

Verification:
- deno check --allow-import backend/retention.cron.ts — expected: no type errors
- Manual: insert fake old rows into autothread_processed / rate_limit_store then run retention cron once and confirm only those rows removed

Red-Green-Refactor plan:
- Red: confirm no retention exists today
- Green: implement safe allow-listed cleanup with batching
- Refactor: extract helper for per-table delete loop

title: API: paginate GET /api/submissions + response schema + shared types
description:
Epic: talk-19w
Epic file: .context/plans/platform-hardening.md
Gate: API response shaping + docs polish (API portion)

Context:
- Admin tooling needs predictable JSON and pagination for submissions.

Scope boundaries:
- ✅ IN scope: backend/index.ts (GET /api/submissions pagination + response schema), shared/types.ts (TalkSubmission + SubmissionsResponse)
- ❌ OUT of scope: auth middleware implementation (separate bead), README updates (docs bead)

Done means:
- GET /api/submissions supports ?limit=&offset= with validation (limit 1-1000, offset >=0)
- Response is { data, total, limit, offset } and JSON-safe (rows mapped to plain objects)
- Uses two-query pattern: COUNT(*) for total and SELECT * LIMIT/OFFSET for data
- shared/types.ts exports TalkSubmission + SubmissionsResponse matching the API

Verification:
- deno check --allow-import backend/index.ts — expected: no type errors
- Manual: curl GET /api/submissions?limit=2&offset=0 returns 2 items and includes total/limit/offset

Red-Green-Refactor plan:
- Red: confirm current endpoint returns raw rows array (no pagination)
- Green: implement query params + response wrapper + types
- Refactor: extract pagination parsing helper if it improves clarity
